Gourmet Chicken Brie Sandwich on Homemade Focaccia

Prep: 30 min Cook: 25 min Servings: 4
sandwich chicken bread

Ingredients

For the Focaccia Bread (4 rounds)

For the Chicken

For Assembly

Instructions

Make the Focaccia Bread

  1. Autolyse: Mix whole wheat flour (200g) and all-purpose flour (200g) with warm water (320ml) and honey (1 tbsp). Rest 30 minutes.
  2. Mix: Add instant yeast (5g), salt (8g), and olive oil (40ml). Mix until combined (wet and sticky is perfect).
  3. First rise: Cover bowl, rise 1.5-2 hours. Every 30 minutes, fold the dough.
  4. Shape: Oil two baking sheets. Divide into 4 pieces, stretch each into 15-18cm circles on the pans.
  5. Second rise: Mix rosemary (2-3 tsp) with olive oil (60ml). Drizzle focaccias lightly with oil, cover with inverted pan, rise 30-45 minutes.
  6. Dimple and bake: Preheat oven to 220°C. Dimple deeply with fingers, drizzle with rosemary oil, sprinkle with coarse salt. Bake 18-22 minutes until golden.

Prepare the Chicken

  1. Pound chicken breasts to 1-1.5cm thickness.
  2. Season with pepper, salt, and garlic powder.
  3. Heat pan with butter and splash of oil, cook chicken 3-4 minutes per side until golden.
  4. Let rest 5 minutes, then add thick slices of brie on top to soften.

Assemble the Sandwich

  1. Slice focaccia horizontally.
  2. Bottom half: Spread with garlic sauce (hot kebab sauce).
  3. Layer in order: Warm chicken with melted brie, fresh basil leaves, tomato slices (lightly salted), thin cucumber slices, sweet pepper strips, avocado slices.
  4. Top half: Spread with Dijon mayonnaise and place on sandwich.
  5. Serve immediately while the chicken is warm and the brie is perfectly soft.

Notes

The leftover focaccias can be saved for tomorrow or frozen. The focaccia dough should be wet and sticky - this is what creates the perfect texture. Make sure to dimple the dough deeply before baking for the characteristic focaccia texture.
